title: Teacher Professional Development: Innovating Mathematics Pedagogy via Sharing Practical Cases

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of secondary-level mathematics curriculum and basic teaching methodologies
context.additional_context: A process for corporate education instructors to develop mathematics teaching expertise by sharing and analyzing actual classroom cases, systematizing individual and organizational practical experiences into mid-level expressions (stories, work materials, etc.) to facilitate knowledge sharing.

learning_goals: Participants can document success/failure cases experienced in math classes using structured storyboarding techniques.
Learners can analyze peer teachers' practical cases to derive three or more applicable strategies for their own instruction.
Learners can develop one blended instructional design plan combining digital tools and physical educational materials.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
